p: About 80% of significant, prolonged wheezing episodes in children are triggered by respiratory viruses and HRV is most often involved ( 3). The common rhinovirus cold accounts in large part for the fall seasonal peak of asthma in school-age children. Epidemiologic evidence combined with viral molecular diagnosis has suggested that this peak is a consequence of children returning to the classroom with the subsequent spread of respiratory viruses, mainly rhinoviruses ( 6).
